name: Ice Maker Hardware Test Plan
description: Automated electrical measurements for ice makers: compressor current, evaporator temperature, water pump current, power consumption
safetyWarnings: Allow compressor to stabilize for 2 minutes before reading current
Evaporator surfaces can reach sub-zero temperatures - use insulated probes
Ensure water reservoir is filled before starting compressor test

steps.name: Compressor Current Draw
steps.description: Measure compressor motor current during normal operation. High current may indicate refrigerant issues or compressor wear.
steps.setupInstructions: Clamp current clamp around power cord. Turn on ice maker. Wait 2 minutes for compressor to engage and stabilize.

steps.name: Total Power Consumption
steps.description: Measure total power draw including compressor, fans, and water pump.
steps.setupInstructions: Connect through power meter. Turn on and initiate ice cycle. Record after compressor stabilizes.

steps.name: Evaporator Temperature
steps.description: Measure evaporator surface temperature to verify cooling performance. Must reach freezing within 10 minutes.
steps.setupInstructions: Attach thermocouple probe to evaporator surface (finger bars). Allow ice maker to run for 10 minutes. Record temperature.

steps.name: Water Pump Current
steps.description: Measure water pump motor current during ice cycle. Low or zero current indicates pump failure.
steps.setupInstructions: If pump wiring is accessible, clamp around pump wire. Otherwise, observe current spike when pump cycles on (visible on total current).

steps.name: Safety Ground Continuity
steps.description: Verify ground continuity between plug ground pin and chassis metal.
steps.setupInstructions: Unplug unit. Measure resistance between ground pin and any exposed metal on chassis.
